definition: to uncover/to open
to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: sons and daughters of China opened a prelude to invasion.
sentences.chinese: 虎門銷煙揭開了中華兒女反侵略的序幕。

sentences.english: He took the cover off the font , and put his white gloves in it.
sentences.chinese: 他揭開聖水器的蓋子，把自己的白手套放了進去。

sentences.english: And a provocative exhibition tries to unpick the myth about the world's most famous apeman .
sentences.chinese: 法國引人入勝的展覽欲揭開世界上最有名的猿人之謎。

sentences.english: Do not open the fuel tank cap while the engine is running or when the engine is hot.
sentences.chinese: 當發動機正在運轉或溫度高時，請勿揭開油箱蓋。
他們舊事重提，揭開了舊的傷痕。

sentences.english: Bagpipes and dancing open the competitions of local sporting events, which are called Highland Gatherings.
sentences.chinese: 高地風笛與利爾舞揭開了高地運動盛會的序幕。

sentences.english: Joey and his buddies kicked off their summer vacation with a trip to the beach.
sentences.chinese: 喬伊和他的死黨以一場海灘之旅來爲璁假揭開序幕。

sentences.english: The prelude of the night is commenced in the music of the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 晚間的序幕於夕陽的樂曲聲中揭開。

sentences.english: The thirsty porter uncovered the kettle , and then drank the juice until the last drop.
sentences.chinese: 那位口渴的搬運工揭開壺蓋，把一壺果汁喝光了。

sentences.english: This is a book that bares some of the major scars of western culture.
sentences.chinese: 一本揭開了西方文化主要傷疤的書。

sentences.english: Reaching back, I pulled off the lid of the top box.
sentences.chinese: 伸手過去，我揭開最上面盒子的蓋子。

sentences.english: The mysterious figure of the answer to the trilogy was only the third kick.
sentences.chinese: 這個神祕人物的謎底到了三部曲的第三部才被揭開。

sentences.english: When he got the lid off the box, he saw a man lying in it.
sentences.chinese: 當他揭開箱子蓋時，他看到有個人躺在裏面。

sentences.english: I have uncovered the grand veil.
They could disclose an awful lot of information—names of interrogators and medical personnel.
sentences.chinese: 一些審訊和醫療人員名單可能揭開很多駭人的信息。

definition: a succession of/a series of
to open/to start/(computing) to enable
to unfold/to carry out/to be in full swing/to launch
to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
to be witness to/witness/evidence
to open/to show (a ticket)/to turn on/to switch on
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
(of a story etc) to unfold/to play out/to develop (a technique etc)/to enact/(logic) to deduce/to infer
to enter
to appear/to emerge/to present (a certain appearance)/to demonstrate
general/commander-in-chief (military)/king (chess piece)/to command/to lead
to desire/to invite/to request
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
to reappear
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
to talk about/to narrate/to give an account
to decipher/to decode/to interpret
dialogue/CL:個|个[ge4]
